definition: to get rid of/to dismiss/to brush aside
to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: In my mind, it helps me avoid misery and find out the happiness.
sentences.chinese: 在我的心目里，它可以帮我屏除烦恼，寻到快乐。

sentences.english: And luxury lies not in richness and ornateness but in the absence of vulgarity.
sentences.chinese: 奢侈并不意味着贵重与装饰华丽，奢侈就是屏除粗俗。

sentences.english: Put away self-centre, then you'll have happy life.
sentences.chinese: 契合空性，屏除自我执着，才有自在逍遥的人生。

sentences.english: We should dismiss all thought of revenge.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该屏除一切报复的念头。

sentences.english: I really have to do something about my laziness.
sentences.chinese: 我真的应该采取措施来屏除我的惰性了。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the jury is still out on them.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的我们的评鉴人员还是将他们屏除在外。

definition: variant of 思維|思维[si1 wei2]
variant of 壓服|压服[ya1 fu2]
congestion/to block/to congest/to crowd/to choke/to cram/to fill up/to stuff/to take up all the space
to understand/to comprehend the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
see 弦外之音[xian2 wai4 zhi1 yin1]
variant of 徹底|彻底[che4 di3]
to look at sth carefully/to examine
